en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.4: Cows, mooshrooms, and sheep all eat Wheat. Pigs can eat Carrots or Beetroot. Chickens love Seeds of any kinds. Rabbits will eat Carrots, Golden Carrots, or Dandelions. Ocelots enjoy Raw Cod or Salmon. Wolves like to eat any kind of meat.
en_us.howtoplay.ranching.text.5: Animals will follow you when you hold their desired food item. This will help you lead them to your ranch or another animal.
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.title: How to Play: Recipe Book
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.text.1.keyboard: Don't worry, you don't need to remember every recipe by heart. The §erecipe book§f in your inventory keeps track of blocks and items you can craft - simply click a recipe to see what you need to craft it.
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.text.1.gamepad: Don't worry, you don't need to remember every recipe by heart. The §erecipe book§f in your inventory keeps track of blocks and items you can craft - simply select a recipe to see what you need to craft it.
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.text.1.touch: Don't worry, you don't need to remember every recipe by heart. The §erecipe book§f in your inventory keeps track of blocks and items you can craft - simply tap a recipe to see what you need to craft it.
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.text.2.keyboard: Once you've gathered the required crafting ingredients, click the recipe once more, then move it from the output slot to your hotbar or inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.text.2.gamepad: Once you've gathered the required crafting ingredients, select the recipe once more, then move it from the output slot to your hotbar or inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.recipeBook.text.2.touch: Once you've gathered the required crafting ingredients, tap the recipe once more, then move it from the output slot to your hotbar or inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.1: Redstone Dust comes from Redstone Ore. This dust transmits an electrical signal. When it has power it lights up and transmits its signal to other Redstone items that are next to it.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.2: In order for one of these items to be powered, it needs a power source such as a Lever, Button, or Pressure Plate. Experiment to find them all!
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.3: Place some Redstone Dust next to a power source and turn it on to power it.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.4: There are many items that use a Redstone signal to do something, such as a Hopper or a Piston.
en_us.howtoplay.redstone.text.5: Redstone allows for endless possibilities! Try creating something useful for yourself like an automatic farm!
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.text.1: A social hub for you and all the members of the Realm. Share your adventures and creations by posting stories to the Story Feed, like and comment to celebrate stories posted by other members.
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.text.2: Clicking the ADD STORY button on the Story Feed will let you write a story of your own. You can choose to include a screenshot or text (or both!). Clicking the POST button will post your text/screenshot to the Story Feed for all the Realm's members to enjoy. If you don't have any screenshots to post, use the §ecamera§f:camera: on the game menu to capture the moment.
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.text.3: Whenever there is a new story in the Feed that you haven't read yet, a number will appear on the REALMS STORIES button. You'll always know when there is something new to read from your Realm's community. If you like what someone shared, go ahead and leave them a like or comment on their story!
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.text.4: See who's playing and when in the Timeline. Scroll through the members of the Realm to see when they played last and who they played with. Use this information to set up times when you can all play together.
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.header.4: Know who is on the Realm
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.text.5: Get to know who is part of the Realm by using the Members tab. It's a list of all the players who can play here. You can see who the Realm owner is, who the operators are, and who has joined Realms Stories for this Realm. There are search, sort, and filter options to help you find exactly who you're looking for.
en_us.howtoplay.realms_stories.text.6: Realms Stories is available in the game menu when you're playing in the Realm and on the Realms Tab. You can keep up to date and tell your story from anywhere you are, even when you aren't playing. From your console, computer, and mobile device, Realms Stories is available everywhere.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.keyboard: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :_input_key.jump:. If you want to travel downward you can press :_input_key.sneak:.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.gamepad: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :_input_key.jump:. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold :_input_key.sneak:.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1a.touch: Scaffolding can help with building large structures by offering a way to reach higher places and safely descend without taking fall damage.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1b.touch: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap :touch_jump: to climb up a column of scaffolding. Tap :touch_fly_down: to climb down.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1c.touch: When using a Joystick control scheme, press :tip_virtual_button_jump: to climb up a column of scaffolding. Tap :tip_virtual_button_sneak: to climb down.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.2: Scaffolding needs support. You can only place so many scaffolding horizontally without touching a different block. When you attempt to place too many scaffolding blocks without proper support, it will fall. Scaffolding can be placed like normal blocks, but it can also be placed on its own foundation to quickly build a tall tower.
en_us.howtoplay.scaffolding.text.3: When Scaffolding is broken it will also break every Scaffolding block that was being supported by it. This will let you quickly clean up your scaffolding by breaking the supporting blocks!
en_us.howtoplay.skins.text.1: Put on some fresh pixels and express yourself with a huge variety of inspired looks.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.1: Structure Blocks give creators the ability to copy and save out sections of their world into structures. Saved structures can then be pasted back into the world.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.2: To get a Structure Block you must use the /give slash command. To use a Structure Block, you must have Operator permissions.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.3: Structure Blocks have 4 modes that can be switched between with the Mode dropdown: Save, Load, Corner, and 3D Export.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.4: Save mode saves an area of the world as a structure.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.5: Load mode loads a structure into the world. Only structures saved to the world or included in a behavior pack that is applied to the world can be loaded.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.6: Corner mode is used with save mode's detect button to automatically set the area you want to save. See the Corner Mode section below for more details.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.7: 3D Export exports a 3D model file on supported platforms.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.8: On the right side of the Structure Block screen, a preview of the area you have selected or the structure to load will appear depending on the mode the block is in.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.9.keyboar: Press :_input_key.attack: and drag, to rotate the 3D preview.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.9.touch: Touch and drag on the preview to rotate the 3D preview.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.10: Redstone can be used to activate a Structure Block. This will cause it to either save a structure out or load a structure into the world, depending on the mode of the block and its settings.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.11: You can change how much of a structure is loaded in by changing the values for Integrity and Seed.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.12: Integrity - the percentage of blocks to load in from the structure, accepted values are 0 to 100. Blocks will be chosen randomly if a Seed is not specified.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.13: Seed - the value entered here will determine which blocks to remove when using Integrity. Leave this field blank if you want the blocks to be chosen randomly.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.14: When a structure with Structure Void blocks is loaded into the world, any block that would have been removed where the structure void block is loading into, will instead stay in the world.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.15: Example: loading an empty shipwreck into the bottom of the ocean will normally copy air over the water blocks. If the shipwreck was filled with structure void, then the water will stay, and you will have a shipwreck filled with water.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.16: To automatically select the area you want to save, you can place Corner Mode blocks around your structure and name them with the same name as the structure you want to save.
en_us.howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.17: Pressing the Detect button in Save mode will find all of the Corner Blocks with the same name and create a selection area so that it will save everything inside of the volume those Corner Blocks make.
en_us.howtoplay.shulkerBoxes.text.1: Combine two Shulker Shells with a Chest to create a Shulker Box. Shulker Shells are dropped by Shulkers found in End Cities. Unlike other containers, Shulker Boxes keep their items when broken. Shulker Boxes will break and drop as an item if pushed by Pistons, and can be placed using Dispensers.
en_us.howtoplay.theCraftingTable.title: How to Play: The Crafting Table
en_us.howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.1: Ready to take your crafting to the next level? Place four planks in a square in your crafting grid, and you'll get a §ecrafting table§f :crafting_table: - a whole new way to craft.
en_us.howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.2.keyboa: Place your crafting table in the world, then right-click it to open it. The larger crafting grid will let you make bigger and better things, including tools, beds, and doors.
en_us.howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.2.gamepa: Place your crafting table in the world, then walk up to it and press :_input_key.use: to open it. The larger crafting grid will let you make bigger and better things, including tools, beds, and doors.
en_us.howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.2.touch: Place your crafting table in the world, then tap it to open it. The larger crafting grid will let you make bigger and better things, including tools, beds, and doors.
en_us.howtoplay.theEnd.text.1: The End is another dimension which can be accessed through an active End Portal. The End Portal can be found in a Stronghold, which is deep underground in the Overworld.
en_us.howtoplay.theEnd.text.2: Every End Portal Frame block is missing something mysterious to bring out the power within.
en_us.howtoplay.theEnd.text.3: Once the portal is active, jump into it to go to The End.
en_us.howtoplay.theEnd.text.4: The End is home to the dreaded Ender Dragon. She is a fierce and powerful enemy and seems to draw power from strange crystals. Her breath and fireball attacks leave lingering acid across the battlefield. Bring some friends to ensure your victory!
en_us.howtoplay.theEnd.text.5: If once wasn't enough, add four End Crystals to the exit portal corners to reawaken the Ender Dragon.
en_us.howtoplay.textures.text.1: Texture packs visually transform the game's appearance, applying a fresh coat of paint to your Minecraft world.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.1: There are many tools in Minecraft that will allow you mine blocks faster than your fist. Tools can be crafted from Wood, Stone, Iron, Gold, Diamond, or Netherite.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.2: Using the right tool for the job will not only mine that block faster, but will also lose less durability. More complex tools must be created in order to mine rarer resources.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.3: The Pickaxe is good at breaking hard blocks like Cobblestone, Iron, or Furnaces.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.4: The Axe is good at breaking wooden blocks like Logs, Planks, or Crafting Tables.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.5.notTouch: The Shovel is good at breaking loose blocks like Dirt, Sand, and Gravel. Shovels can also create a path by pressing :_input_key.use: on grass blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.5.touch: The Shovel is good at breaking loose blocks like Dirt, Sand, and Gravel. Shovels can also create a path by tapping on grass blocks.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.6.notTouch: The Hoe is required for tilling Dirt to plant crops. Press :_input_key.use: on Dirt or Grass blocks to turn them into Farmland.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.6.touch: The Hoe is required for tilling Dirt to plant crops. Tap Dirt or Grass blocks to turn them into Farmland.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.7: All of these tools can accept enchantments, either from the Enchanting Table or Anvil.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.8: There are even more tools to aid you on your adventure:
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.9: A Bucket will allow you to collect things like Water, Milk, Lava, and even Fish.
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.10: Flint & Steel allows you to light fires... be careful in densely wooded areas!
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.11: A Fishing Rod lets you catch fish and other loot from water blocks. It can also be used to pull other players and mobs. Fishing Rods can also be enchanted!
en_us.howtoplay.tools.text.12: Shears are very handy for collecting items like Wool, Leaves, and Cobwebs.
en_us.howtoplay.trading.text.1: Trading can be done in villages. Each villager has a profession; they can be Farmers, Butchers, Blacksmiths, Cartographers, Librarians, or Priests. Some professions will trade for items that other professions cannot. Explore and trade with many villagers to find all the trades.
en_us.howtoplay.trading.text.2: You can find out what a villager is offering as trade by interacting with them. A villager may adjust the price of a trade whenever a player trades with it. A villager may run out of stock, temporarily disabling the trade if it is used too frequently. Trades usually involve buying or selling items for emeralds.
en_us.howtoplay.trading.text.3: As you trade with villagers, they will get better at their profession and start to offer better and more valuable trades.
en_us.howtoplay.trading.text.4: Take care of your villagers, they need to rest, work, and eat to thrive.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.1: There are many ways to get around other than walking or riding a mount or flying.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.2: Minecarts are ridable carts that roll on Rails. You can make the Rails go wherever you want by placing them next to each other. Place a Minecart on the Rails and you are ready to ride.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.2.touch: Minecarts are ridable carts that roll on Rails, which you can build to go anywhere. Just place multiple Rails next to each other, place a Minecart on it, and you're ready to ride.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.3.keyboard: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Minecart to hop in and ride. Press :_input_key.forward: to roll forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.3.gamepad: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Minecart to hop in and ride. Push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward to roll forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.3a.touch: Look at a Minecart and tap "Ride" to hop in.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.3b.touch: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap and hold :touch_forward: to start moving forward and build momentum, and tap :touch_jump: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.3c.touch: When using a Joystick control scheme, drag :tip_virtual_joystick: up to start moving forward and build momentum, and tap :tip_virtual_button_dismount: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.4: Boats let you travel across water. Place one on a water block and you are ready to go.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.4.touch: Boats let you travel across water. Just place one on a water block and you're ready to go.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.5.keyboard: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Boat to board it. Press :_input_key.left: or :_input_key.right: to turn left or right. Press :_input_key.forward: to move forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.5.gamepad: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Boat to board it. Push :_gamepad_stick_left: left or right to turn. Push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward to move forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.5a.touch: Look at a Boat and tap "Board" to board it.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.5b.touch: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap :touch_left: or :touch_right: to turn left or right, or tap and hold both to move forward. Tap "Leave Boat" to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.transportation.text.5c.touch: When using a Joystick control scheme, drag :tip_virtual_joystick: up to move forward and tap :tip_virtual_button_dismount: to get out.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.1: The Sword is the primary melee weapon in Minecraft. It can be made from Wood, Stone, Iron, Gold, Diamond, or Netherite. Jump attacks do critical damage!
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.2.notTouch: Press :_input_key.attack: with a Sword in your hand to attack.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.3.notTouch: The Bow is the primary ranged weapon in Minecraft. Press and hold :_input_key.use: to draw the bow back. Release :_input_key.use: to fire an arrow. The bow requires arrows to fire.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.3.touch: The Bow is the primary ranged weapon in Minecraft. Press and hold the Screen to draw the bow back. Release the press to fire an arrow. The bow requires arrows to fire.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.4: Bows do more damage the further they are pulled back, make sure to pull it all the way back.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.5.notTouch: The Crossbow is an alternate ranged weapon. Press and hold :_input_key.use: to load the crossbow. Once the Crossbow is loaded, it will stay loaded until it is fired. Press :_input_key.use: to fire an arrow. The Crossbow requires arrows to load.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.5a.touch: The crossbow is a ranged weapon which requires an arrow to be loaded. Tap and hold anywhere on the screen to load the crossbow with an arrow.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.5b.touch: Once you've loaded the crossbow it'll stay loaded until fired, even when you put it in your inventory.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.5c.touch: Tap anywhere on the screen to fire a loaded crossbow.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.5d.touch: If you're using Action Buttons, tap :tip_virtual_button_action_build_or_use: to fire a loaded crossbow.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.6.notTouch: The Trident is a dual-purpose melee and ranged weapon. Press :_input_key.attack: to attack. Press and hold :_input_key.use: to draw the trident back. Release :_input_key.use: to throw the trident. The Trident is the best weapon underwater.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.6.touch: The Trident is a dual-purpose melee and ranged weapon. Tap mobs to attack them. Press and hold the Screen to draw the trident back. Release the press to throw the trident. The Trident is the best weapon underwater.
en_us.howtoplay.weapons.text.7: The Sword, Bow, Crossbow, and Trident have specific enchantments that you can get from the Enchanting Table or Anvil that will improve damage, durability and even light mobs on fire!
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.1: Worlds in the Minecraft Marketplace Minecraft levels where our partners have altered the terrain and placed new blocks to create amazing structures and terrain for you to explore and enjoy.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.2: Worlds can also include new items, mobs, blocks and even custom gameplay.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.3: All of the content in the Marketplace is created by our professional commiunity creators.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.4: Worlds can do so much, we've created several Sub-Categories to help describe what they can do:
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.5: Mini-Games are smaller worlds that include new game mechanics, challenges, or rules.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.6: These games are made with multiplayer in mind, letting you test your skills and have fun with your friends.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.7: Survival Spawns let you start playing in a custom-built world, while still enjoying the classic survival mechanics of Minecraft.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.8: Just like in Survival mode you will have health and hunger, and need to fight dangerous mobs.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.9: Adventure Maps let you use Minecraft to play a totally different kind of game.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.10: You can not break blocks or place new blocks in these worlds.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.11: Dynamic Worlds allow you to explore the creative designs of our marketplace creators in a randomly generated map.
en_us.howtoplay.worlds.text.12: Worlds can have new biomes, customized structures (randomly generated buildings), new blocks, textures, and mobs.
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.title: How to Play: Your First Craft
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.1: Many blocks, like wood, can be turned into useful items by crafting. To do this, you'll find a simple §ecrafting grid§f on the right-hand side of your inventory screen.
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.2: For example, put a single wood log anywhere on the crafting grid, and several planks will appear in the §eoutput slot§f.
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.3.touch: Simply tap your shiny new planks and they will appear in your hotbar. Now you're ready to place them into the world!
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.3.keyboard: Simply drag your shiny new planks to your hotbar. Now you're ready to place them into the world!
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.3.gamepad: Simply select your shiny new planks and they will appear in your hotbar. Now you're ready to place them into the world!
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.4: Some items require you to place your crafting ingredients in a certain shape - also called a §erecipe§f.
en_us.howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.5: Try placing two planks above each other to create some sticks. Useful for all sorts of things!

en_us.options.dev_connection_nolimit: Full network stack enabled - No limits

en_us.options.hidehand.description: Hides your hands from first-person view, as well as any items you might be holding

en_us.options.turnOnHardcoreMode.message.1: 1. When you die, you will not respawn — game over!
en_us.options.turnOnHardcoreMode.message.2: 2. Hardcore mode can’t be turned off after the world is created.

en_us.progressScreen.message.postUploadFailure: Your upload succeeded, but refreshing world data failed. Your changes may not be shown immediately.
en_us.progressScreen.message.modifiedWorldWarn: You're playing in a world with Add-Ons! This will add new features to your Minecraft world.
Don't stop with just one! You can load multiple Add-Ons onto a single world at once.
Advanced Tip: A Resource Pack can change the textures of different blocks and entities.
Advanced Tip: A Behavior Pack can change how different items, entities, or blocks work.
Advanced Tip: An Add-On includes both a Behavior Pack and a Resource Pack. Make sure both packs are activated to ensure the Add-On works!
Add-Ons add new blocks, items, or mobs to your worlds.
Worlds and Add-ons are complex! While some work great together, you might get funky results with others.
More Add-Ons mean more fun, but the game might take longer to load.
en_us.progressScreen.dialog.message.resourcePa: Some optional resource packs applied to this world include ray tracing. Your device is not compatible with advanced lighting and texture features so you will see the world without these advanced effects.

Some optional and required resource packs applied to this world include ray tracing. Your device is not compatible with advanced lighting and texture features so you will see the world without these advanced effects.

Some required resource packs applied to this world include ray tracing. Your device is not compatible with advanced lighting and texture features so you will see the world without these advanced effects.
This world has optional Resource Packs applied to it. Would you like to download them before you join?
This world has optional Resource Packs and required Resource Packs from Add-Ons applied to it. Would you like to download all packs or only the ones required to join?
This world has required Resource Packs from Add-Ons applied to it. Would you like to download them and join?
The owner of this world requires players to download all Resource Packs applied to it. Would you like to download them and join?

The world is not fully synced or has been corrupted. Try playing the world on a console where it's in a good state and try migrating it again.
Local save successful but cloud sync failed due to quota. Free cloud space by deleting worlds from the settings menu.
Not enough local free space to support cloud sync.

en_us.resourcePack.description: Resource packs are applied bottom to top. This means any asset that is in two packs will be overridden by the higher pack.
en_us.resourcePack.description.default.level: You can edit these in Settings.
en_us.resourcePack.description.bottom.global: Resource packs are applied bottom to top. This means any asset that is in two packs will be overridden by the higher pack. Packs in your worlds will apply on top of these global packs. These resources are just for you. No one else will see the resources you set here. Resource Packs in your worlds or worlds you join will apply on top of these global resources.
en_us.resourcePack.description.bottom.behavior: Behavior Packs are applied bottom to top. That means anything that is in two Behavior Packs will be overridden by the higher one.
en_us.resourcePack.description.bottom.level: Resource packs are applied bottom to top. This means any asset that is in two packs will be overridden by the higher pack. These packs in your world apply on top of your global pack(s).

en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.1: Want to get the most out of your equipment? You'll need a Smithing Table.
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.2: Use it to make all kinds of changes, for example by upgrading Diamond equipment to Netherite, or by making cosmetic changes with Armor Trims.
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.3: In order to upgrade your equipment, you'll need a Smithing Template. You can find a large variety throughout the world, which can be used for all kinds of upgrades.
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.4: Place a Template into the leftmost slot of a Smithing Table to see which items you need for the upgrade.
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.5: For example, to upgrade Diamond equipment to Netherite, you need a Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template, which you can find in Bastion Remnants. Then, place the Diamond equipment in the equipment slot and a Netherite ingot in the ingredient slot, and you're done!
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.6: Item properties such as enchantments and armor trims will be retained, but the Smithing Template will be consumed when you upgrade your equipment. Don't worry - you can craft copies of them with your Crafting Table.
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.7: Get creative and customize the look of your armor with Armor Trims. You'll need an Armor Trim Smithing Template to get started, which you can find throughout the world.
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.8: Place a Template into the leftmost slot of a Smithing Table to see which items you need for the upgrade. Then place a piece of armor in the equipment slot and a crystal or ingot in the ingredient slot. Done!
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.text.9: Only certain crystals and ingots can be used for Armor Trims. Try different kinds like Iron, Gold, or Lapis to create unique designs!
en_us.howtoplay.smithing_table.title: Smithing Table

en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info1.line1: Your own personal Realm server: a persistent world always online for you and your friends!
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info1.line2: Friends play on your Realm for free
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info1.line3: Jump from console to mobile to PC - play your Realm on any device with the Minecraft Marketplace
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info2.catalog: Free access to a catalog of 150+ Marketplace packs
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info2.backups: Worlds on your Realm include free secure backups
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info2.renews: Subscription renews automatically each month until canceled
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info2.cancel: Cancel on the Subscriptions page of Minecraft Settings
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info2.persona: Free Character Creator items - redeem a new set each month!
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info3.para1: Realms are available in Minecraft %s for all Realms subscribers for free! This is a new Realm that gives you the chance to try new features before their release.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info3.para2: With a Realm subscription, you can create a new %s Realm using the “Create New” button in the main menu. If you don’t have a Realms subscription yet, please go to the full version of Minecraft to sign up.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info3.para3: All Realms screens and functions are available in %s except purchasing a new subscription or managing the subscriptions of existing Realms.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.landing.info3.para4: Your %s Realm will remain active for as long as you have the paid Realm subscription that your %s Realm is linked to.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer1: Realms Plus is a subscription to a personal server supporting up to 10 simultaneous players, along with unlimited access to 150+ great Minecraft worlds, texture packs, skin packs, and mash-ups for one low monthly price.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer2: A personal server allows you to create a shared world that is always online and accessible from any device with Minecraft Marketplace. Players that you invite to your Realm can play this world at any time.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question3: Do my friends need to purchase Realms Plus to play on my Realm?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer3: Your friends don’t need to purchase a Realms Plus subscription to play on your Realm. You can invite any friend (that has their multiplayer permissions enabled) to join your Realm for free.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question4: Which devices support Realms Plus for Minecraft?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer4: Realms Plus is currently available on any platform where you can install Minecraft Bedrock Edition. You can play Realms and use any content from Realms Plus on any of these devices if you’re signed into your Microsoft account.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question5: How much does a Realms Plus subscription cost?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer5: %s per month for a 10-player server and access to 150+ marketplace packs.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer5.contentSub: %s per month. Add infinite members, play online with 10 other players at the same time. Plus, enjoy over 150 pieces of Marketplace content from the Marketplace Pass catalog for free.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question6: How often are new packs added to Realms Plus?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer6: New packs are added to Realms Plus monthly.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question7: How long do I have access to Packs within Realms Plus?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer7: Realms Plus members enjoy unlimited access to over 150+ great Minecraft worlds, texture packs, skin packs, and mash-ups, until either the subscription expires, or a pack leaves the catalog.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question8: Where can I use Realms Plus packs?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer8: Worlds and packs included in the subscription can either be played online, played on your personal Realm, or played on a local device. You just need to play online once every 30 days to validate that your subscription is active.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question9: What happens to my Realms and worlds when my subscription expires?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer9: If your subscription ends, you and your friends will no longer be able to play online together on Realms, and you will no longer have access to Realms Plus packs. You can download any world saved to your Realm (within 18 months of ending your subscription). If you used Realms Plus worlds, texture packs, or mash-ups you will need to purchase those packs in the store or, if those packs are still in Realms Plus, re-subscribe, to play those world templates.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.question10: Do I need Realms Plus and Marketplace Pass?
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer10: No. Marketplace Pass is a catalog of over 150+ packs for you to enjoy. Realms Plus is a 10 player Realm with Marketplace Pass included. We suggest that you subscribe to the one that’s right for you.
en_us.store.realmsPlus.faq.answer11: Realms Stories is a social hub for your Realm. Post to the Story Feed to let others know what you’re up to, and share your adventures and creations. Know who’s who with a handy list of all the members. See when other members are playing to check out their creations or plan to join them next time.

en_us.store.realmsPlus.content.friendsGetAcces: Your Friends Get Access to the Content Used in Your Realm for Free
en_us.store.realmsPlus.content.contentDescript: Tap into the source of amazing Minecraft content! With Realms Plus, you get instant access to 150+ marketplace items like mash-ups, worlds, skin packs and epic adventures – with new additions each month. Your content is stored on your own personal server, and made available on any platform where you enjoy both Realms and Minecraft Marketplace. Up to 10 players can play at one time, and they get access to the worlds in your Realm for free!
Realms Plus includes Marketplace Pass content. We suggest that you cancel your Marketplace Pass subscription after signing up for Realms Plus.

en_us.store.csb.subscription: After sign up, 150+ pieces of exciting Minecraft Marketplace content will be available to you. Download and play adventure maps, wear skins, dive into texture packs, and even claim a set of Character Creator items to keep each month. With a catalog that’s regularly refreshed, there’s always something new to discover with Marketplace Pass. You’ll be billed %s/month and can cancel anytime to stop future charges.
en_us.store.csb.recurring.offerTrial: Marketplace Pass is an ongoing subscription with a recurring subscription fee which is charged automatically every month until the subscription is cancelled.%s150+ marketplace packs will be immediately available. You can cancel your subscription to stop future charges by accessing subscriptions settings.
en_us.store.csb.recurring.withoutTrial: Marketplace Pass is an ongoing subscription with a recurring subscription fee which is charged automatically every month until the subscription is cancelled.%s150+ marketplace packs will be immediately available. You'll be billed %s/month and you can cancel your subscription to stop future charges by accessing subscriptions settings.
en_us.store.csb.consumable.offerTrial: 150+ marketplace packs will be immediately available. Your first 30 days will be free and you can renew for 30 days at the price of %s afterwards.
en_us.store.csb.consumable.withoutTrial: 150+ marketplace packs will be immediately available. Your subscription will be available for 30 days at the price of %s.
en_us.store.csb.landing.info: Marketplace Pass is a monthly subscription service that gives you access to 150+ pieces of content from Minecraft Marketplace for %s. Your subscription allows you to:
en_us.store.csb.landing.info.line1: Dive into story-driven adventures by downloading and playing one of the many themed worlds and mini-games
en_us.store.csb.landing.info.line2: Change the look of blocks, biomes, and even your favorite Minecraft mobs
en_us.store.csb.landing.info.line4: Claim a new set of time-limited Character Creator items each month, which are yours to keep forever
en_us.store.csb.landing.info.line5: Subscription renews automatically each month until canceled
en_us.store.csb.landing.info.line6: Cancel on the Subscriptions page of Minecraft Settings
en_us.store.csb.landing.info.line8: Enjoy great savings on content in the Marketplace Pass catalog
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer1: Marketplace Pass is subscription service that gives you access to 150+ pieces of content from Minecraft Marketplace for %s/month.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question2: How often is content updated in Marketplace Pass?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer2: Select content refreshes each month so there’s always something new to explore.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question3: What do I need to enjoy Marketplace Pass?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer3: Access to Marketplace Pass requires an active subscription, and a compatible version of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition with Minecraft Marketplace. Requires Microsoft account sign-in.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question4: What happens to my content after it leaves Marketplace Pass?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer4: Once a world, texture pack, skin pack, or mash-up leaves the catalog, you will need to purchase the item from the Marketplace to continue playing. Packs will not be deleted from your local storage until you delete them. Monthly character creator items you’ve redeemed are yours to keep.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question5: What happens when my subscription ends?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer5: You will be able to purchase and download any world templates saved to your cloud storage within 18 months of ending your subscription unless they are no longer offered by Minecraft. Monthly character creator items you’ve redeemed are yours to keep.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question6: What's the difference between this and Realms Plus?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer6: The difference between the two subscriptions is that Realms Plus includes a personal server where you can play with up to ten friends at a time. The content catalog you have access to with your Marketplace Pass subscription is the same catalog that is available with a Realms Plus subscription.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question7: Can I subscribe to both Marketplace Pass and Realms Plus?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer7: A Realms Plus subscription includes Marketplace Pass. If you are subscribed to Marketplace Pass and want to explore Realms Plus, we suggest that you unsubscribe from Marketplace Pass first. Active Realms Plus subscribers are unable to subscribe to Marketplace Pass.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question8: Can I use my Marketplace Pass content on any device?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer8: If you purchase Marketplace Pass, you can access all the packs from any device with a  compatible version of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition with Minecraft Marketplace (sold separately) if you’re signed into your Minecraft account. Not supported on Amazon Kindle Fire or Minecraft Java Edition.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question9: Can I play Marketplace Pass Content if I have joined the Minecraft Beta on Windows or XBOX?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer9: You will be able to see content in your subscription if you are already subscribed, but you will not be able to subscribe to Marketplace Pass from the Preview/BETA build.
en_us.store.csb.faq.question10: Can I purchase the content offered within the marketplace pass catalog to own?
en_us.store.csb.faq.answer10: Yes, subscribers can save on content in the Marketplace Pass catalog - buy your favorites at a discounted rate before they leave the catalog to own them forever.

Select "Cancel" to go and download a copy of the current world to prevent data loss or "Confirm" to continue and replace your world.

en_us.store.progress.dialog.tooltip.2: Find your previous purchases in your library.
en_us.store.progress.dialog.tooltip.3: Check out our minecoin bundles - some come with bonus coins.
en_us.store.progress.dialog.tooltip.4: Rating your purchase sends feedback to our content creators.
en_us.store.progress.dialog.tooltip.5: Add-Ons can be used on both new and existing worlds.
en_us.store.progress.dialog.tooltip.6: Try out all different types of content - worlds, skins, add-ons, textures.
en_us.stream.confirm_start: Are you sure you want to start broadcasting?
en_us.stream.unavailable.account_not_bound: Before you can broadcast Minecraft through Twitch, you will need to link your Twitch account on mojang.com. Would you like to do that now?
en_us.stream.unavailable.account_not_migrated: Before you can broadcast Minecraft through Twitch, you will need to migrate your Minecraft account to a Mojang account. Would you like to do that now?
en_us.stream.unavailable.failed_auth: Authentication to Twitch failed. Please go to mojang.com and rebind your Twitch account.
en_us.stream.unavailable.failed_auth_error: Unable to authenticate to Twitch. Please try again later.
en_us.stream.unavailable.initialization_failur: Unable to initialize the Twitch SDK.
en_us.stream.unavailable.library_arch_mismatch: The custom java version used to launch Minecraft has a different architecture than the one used to run the launcher. Please make sure these are the same, either 32-bit or 64-bit for both.
en_us.stream.unavailable.library_failure: Unable to load the libraries needed for the integrated Twitch broadcasting service.
en_us.stream.unavailable.no_fbo: Your video card needs to support at least OpenGL version 3.0 or support Framebuffer Objects via an extension to use the integrated Twitch broadcasting.
en_us.stream.unavailable.no_fbo.arb: Framebuffer object support via ARB is: %s
en_us.stream.unavailable.no_fbo.blend: Separate blending support via EXT is: %s
en_us.stream.unavailable.no_fbo.ext: Framebuffer object support via EXT is: %s
en_us.stream.unavailable.not_supported.mac: Unfortunately the integrated Twitch broadcasting on Mac requires a version of OSX newer than the one you are on. You must use 10.7 (Mac OS X Lion) or newer to be able to use this service. Would you like to visit apple.com to learn about upgrading?
en_us.stream.unavailable.not_supported.other: Unfortunately the integrated Twitch broadcasting service requires Windows (Vista or newer) or Mac OS X (10.7/Lion or newer)
en_us.stream.unavailable.not_supported.windows: Unfortunately the integrated Twitch broadcasting requires a newer version of Windows than you are on. You must have at least Windows Vista or newer.
en_us.stream.unavailable.soundflower.chat: Soundflower is required to be able to stream on Mac. %s
en_us.stream.unavailable.soundflower.chat.link: Please click here to install it.
en_us.stream.unavailable.title: Twitch Broadcasting Unavailable
en_us.stream.unavailable.unknown: Unfortunately you cannot broadcast to Twitch at this time. And we don't know why :'(

en_us.structure_block.corner.text.1.title: Corner Mode:
en_us.structure_block.corner.text.2.paragraph: Corner Mode is used with the Detect button in Save Mode to define the area to save. It will only detect Corner Blocks with the same name as the structure being saved.

en_us.trial.upsell.title: Let the trial begin!
en_us.trial.upsell.description: In this trial you are limited to 90 minutes of play time. Craft, build, explore, and have fun! Your world will be preserved if you choose to purchase the full version.
en_us.trial.upsell.description.updated: Explore, craft, build, and have fun! In this trial you will have 90 minutes of play time. Unlock the full game to continue playing as long as you want!
en_us.trial.upsell.description.worldsDontTrans: Explore, craft, build, and have fun! In this trial you will have 90 minutes of play time. Unlock the full game to play an infinite amount of worlds for as long as you want!*
*(This world will not transfer to the full game)
en_us.trial.upsell.cb.description.worldsDontTr: Explore, craft, build, and have fun! In this trial world, you will have 90 minutes of play time. Uncover a bug? Report it at bugs.mojang.com! Other questions? Check out our FAQ.
(Trial worlds do not transfer to the full game.)
en_us.ratingPopUp.title: Are you enjoying Minecraft?
en_us.feedbackPopup.title: Do you have any feedback for us?
en_us.trial.upsell.expiredDescription.line1: Time has expired. Please purchase to unlock the full game:
en_us.trial.upsell.expiredNewDescription: Do you want to continue exploring, crafting, and building? Unlock the full game to play as long as you want! This world will be saved for you to pick up where you left off but you can't modify it until you unlock the full game.
en_us.trial.upsell.expiredNewDescription.world: Do you want to continue exploring, crafting, and building? Unlock the full game to play an infinite amount of worlds for as long as you want!*
en_us.trial.upsell.cb.expiredNewDescription.wo: Do you want to continue exploring, crafting, and building? Start a new trial world to continue playing!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.title: Unlock Full Game
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.minecraft.title: MINECRAFT
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.minecraft.descriptio: Endlessly explore your own unique worlds and construct anything you can imagine - from the simplest of homes to the grandest of castles! Play Creative mode to build wonders with unlimited resources. Or mine in Survival mode, crafting weapons and armor to fend off dangerous mobs and survive the nights. Plus, play with friends online! Unlock the full game today!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.xbl.title: MICROSOFT ACCOUNT
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.xbl.description: With the full Minecraft experience you get Creative mode, achievements, and more, plus with a Microsoft account you can meet others in the Minecraft community! Join your friends' worlds, make new friends on Servers, and sync your Marketplace purchases to everywhere you play Minecraft.
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.achievements.title: ACHIEVEMENTS
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.achievements.descrip: In addition to the full Minecraft experience with Creative mode, Multiplayer, and more, you'll earn achievements and a Gamerscore to mark your Minecraft progress and show your Microsoft account friends your accomplishments. Get the full game to start earning them!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.multiplayer.title: MULTIPLAYER
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.multiplayer.descript: The full Minecraft experience lets you enjoy Creative mode, achievements and Multiplayer with your friends across Minecraft devices! Play with friends on console, PC and mobile to create, explore and survive together. Unlock the full Minecraft experience today!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.server.title: SERVERS
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.server.description: Servers offer some of the most creative ways to enjoy Minecraft! Play great mini-games, meet the Minecraft community and make new friends. Unlock the full Minecraft experience to try Servers today!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.store.title: STORE
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.store.description: Get access to Minecraft Marketplace, our in-game store. Switch up your look with new skins, change your world, or explore incredible new maps from the best community creators! Get the full game today!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.creative.title: CREATIVE
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.creative.description: Buy Minecraft and get Creative mode! Access the entire inventory - the only limit to what you can build is your imagination! Fly around your world, make your dream home out of anything and everything, or just blow up a mountain with unlimited TNT!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.addon.title: ADD-ONS
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.addon.description: Want to make wolves act like bunnies? Turn all the trees into cotton candy? You can alter everything in the full Minecraft experience with add-ons! Plus get access to Multiplayer, Creative mode, achievements and more! Buy Minecraft now for full access!
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.seeds.title: SEEDS
en_us.trial.tabbed_upsell.seeds.description: Unlock the full Minecraft experience and get access to Seeds! Seeds help you discover new biomes - survive on ice plains, ascend extreme hills, or trek across deserts. Start with unique templates or explore random new worlds! Access Seeds, Creative mode, Multiplayer and more by buying Minecraft today!
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.title: Thanks for Testing
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.minecraft.title: MINECRAFT TRIAL
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.minecraft.descr: Thank you for downloading the Minecraft Trial for Chromebook! Your playtesting will provide invaluable data for bug fixes and technical troubleshooting. Uncover a bug? Report it at bugs.mojang.com! Other questions? Check out our FAQ.
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.xbl.title: MICROSOFT ACCOUNT
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.xbl.description: With the full Minecraft experience, you get Creative mode, achievements, and more, plus with a Microsoft account you can meet others in the Minecraft community! You’ll be able to join friends’ worlds, make new friends on Servers, and sync your Marketplace purchases to everywhere you play Minecraft.
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.achievements.de: In addition to the full Minecraft experience with Creative mode, Multiplayer, and more, you'll earn achievements and a Gamerscore to mark your Minecraft progress and show your Microsoft account friends your accomplishments.
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.multiplayer.des: The full Minecraft experience lets you enjoy Creative mode, achievements and Multiplayer with your friends across Minecraft devices! Play with friends on console, PC and mobile to create, explore and survive together.
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.server.descript: As a part of the full Minecraft experience, Servers offer some of the most creative ways to enjoy Minecraft! Play great mini-games, meet the Minecraft community and make new friends.
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.store.descripti: The full game allows access to Minecraft Marketplace, our in-game store. Switch up your look with new skins, change your world, or explore incredible new maps from the best community creators!
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.creative.descri: A beloved part of the full Minecraft experience: Creative mode! Access the entire inventory - the only limit to what you can build is your imagination! Fly around your world, make your dream home out of anything and everything, or just blow up a mountain with unlimited TNT!
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.addon.descripti: Want to make wolves act like bunnies? Turn all the trees into cotton candy? You can alter everything in the full Minecraft experience with add-ons! Plus get access to Multiplayer, Creative mode, achievements and more!
en_us.trial.thanks_for_testing.seeds.descripti: The full Minecraft experience unlocks access to Seeds! Seeds help you discover new biomes - survive on ice plains, ascend extreme hills, or trek across deserts. Start with unique templates or explore random new worlds!
en_us.trial.starter.collection.title: Minecraft Starter Collection
en_us.trial.master.collection.title: Minecraft Master Collection
en_us.trial.starter.offer: Get Minecraft, 700 Minecoins, 2 skin packs, 1 texture pack and 1 mash-up
en_us.trial.master.offer: Get Minecraft, 1000 Minecoins, 4 skin packs, 2 texture packs, 3 maps, and 1 mash-up

en_us.trial.collection.1.description: Buy skins, textures and worlds in the Marketplace!
en_us.trial.collection.2.title: 700 Minecoins

en_us.trial.collection.3.title: Wildlife: Savanna
en_us.trial.collection.3.description: Go on safari in a rugged off-road vehicle that seats 4!
en_us.trial.collection.4.title: Adventurer's Dream
en_us.trial.collection.4.description: Explore Noxcrew's magical world full of ancient castles!
en_us.trial.collection.5.title: PureBDcraft Pack
en_us.trial.collection.5.description: Transform your Minecraft world into a comic!
en_us.trial.collection.6.title: Relics of Privateers
en_us.trial.collection.6.description: Vast tropical wilderness on a whirlwind hunt for treasure!
en_us.trial.collection.7.title: Greek Mythology Mash-up
en_us.trial.collection.7.description: Explore an ancient world, texture pack and skins!

en_us.trial.collection.8.description: Playgrounds filled with games and challenges!
en_us.trial.collection.9.title: Pastel Skin Pack
en_us.trial.collection.9.description: Get ready for an explosion of rainbow pastel happiness!
en_us.trial.collection.10.title: Plastic Texture Pack
en_us.trial.collection.10.description: Make your worlds simple, colorful and vibrant!
en_us.trial.collection.11.title: Skin Pack 1
en_us.trial.collection.11.description: Customize your character with this selection of skins!

en_us.trial.collection.12.description: Dress as a Cake Maniac, Frankencrafter, or Worse!
en_us.trial.survival.mode.title: SURVIVAL
en_us.trial.creative.mode.title: CREATIVE
en_us.trial.survival.mode.1.intro_description: The original Minecraft experience: collect resources to craft tools and build structures, find and farm food to manage your hunger, battle dangerous mobs, and explore a vast world.
en_us.trial.survival.mode.2.intro_description: Start by collecting some wood and dirt for a makeshift home to help you survive the first night! From there it's all up to you.
en_us.trial.creative.mode.1.intro_description: Build anything you can imagine in Creative Mode. Take no damage, fly through the skies, and enjoy instant access to every block in the game! This mode lets you focus on crafting and gives you everything you need to build something beautiful!
en_us.trial.creative.mode.2.intro_description: You'll also have access to Inspiration Island, a tutorial world and introduction to Creative mode that'll teach you how to be a master builder in no time! You can find more great worlds like this in Minecraft Marketplace.

en_us.tips.edu.1: You can hold down Shift to take a close up picture using the Camera.
en_us.tips.edu.2: Unlike Signs, you can edit Slates, Posters, and Boards over and over again.
en_us.tips.edu.3: Use Ctrl+B to turn on text-to-speech capabilities for in-game chat.
en_us.tips.edu.4: You can export your Minecraft world to share it with others.
en_us.tips.edu.5: To have your peers connect to your world, pause your game and share your join code.
en_us.tips.edu.6: Remember that to use slash commands, you need to enable cheats in your world.
en_us.tips.edu.7: Done with your creation? Have others tour your world as visitors to protect your work.
en_us.tips.edu.8: To code in Minecraft, press "C" on your keyboard or touch the Agent icon at the top of your screen.
en_us.tips.edu.9: Use the Library to find new game worlds to build in.
en_us.tips.edu.10: Looking for a specific biome? Try the Library.
en_us.tips.edu.12: In Survival Mode, players must find their own resources.
en_us.tips.edu.13: In Creative Mode, players can freely choose to build from any of the blocks in Minecraft.
en_us.tips.edu.14: Your code building robot helper is called the Agent.
en_us.tips.edu.15: Redstone can be used in Minecraft to create circuits and simple machines.
en_us.tips.edu.16: You can copy and paste from a text editor to a slate, poster, board, or into chat.
en_us.tips.edu.17: Show hints for commonly-used keyboard and mouse controls by pressing "H" on your keyboard.
en_us.tips.edu.18: You can toggle Auto Jump on or off in the Settings menu under Controls.
en_us.tips.edu.19: While in Creative Mode, quickly press jump twice to fly.
en_us.tips.edu.20: Choose a Default Game Mode when creating a world to specify the type of gameplay you want.
en_us.tips.edu.21: Use the command "/setworldspawn" to have new players begin playing where you are standing.
en_us.tips.edu.22: Choose a default player permission when creating your world to specify the permissions you want your classmates to have when they join.
en_us.tips.edu.23: Press "I" on your keyboard or touch the Immersive Reader icon to read or translate in-game text.
en_us.tips.edu.24: To add or change an NPC in your world, first make yourself a world builder with "/wb".
en_us.tips.edu.25: There's a brand new build challenge every month! Find them all in the Library under Monthly Build Challenges.
en_us.tips.edu.26: Find related lessons by clicking on tags in the Library.
en_us.tips.edu.27: Game moving slowly? Try turning down the render distance in Settings.
en_us.tips.edu.28: Want to use Code Builder? Make sure cheats are toggled on.
en_us.tips.edu.29: Press F5 to change player perspective.
en_us.tips.edu.30: Use "/spawnpoint" to change your spawn point. It's just like you slept in a bed!
en_us.beginnerTips.1: Most monsters only come out at night. During the day you're safe... probably.
en_us.beginnerTips.2: Break blocks, pick up resources. Use the crafting grid to make helpful items. Now you're crafting!
en_us.beginnerTips.3: You have endless lives, but your items drop to the ground when you die. Hurry back to pick them up!
en_us.beginnerTips.4: It's a good idea to build a place where you can safely spend the night.
en_us.beginnerTips.5: Use the right tool for the job! Chopping wood with an axe is much faster than using your hands.
en_us.beginnerTips.6: Even in Minecraft you'll get hungry, so try to find something to eat before that happens.
en_us.beginnerTips.7: Digging straight down or straight up might not be a great idea.
en_us.beginnerTips.8: Monsters spawn in the dark. Craft a torch to brighten up any space.
en_us.beginnerTips.9: Beds are great! Craft one to quickly pass the night and set your respawn point.
en_us.beginnerTips.10: Be careful when you swim. Stay under water for too long and you'll run out of air.
en_us.beginnerTips.11: Survival mode has 4 different difficulty levels - Peaceful, Easy, Normal, and Hard. Or play Creative mode and get endless resources!
en_us.beginnerTips.12: The world of Minecraft is endlessly surprising. You'll find lots of different animals, plants, and even §f§k§a§b§r §f§k§a§b§r
en_us.midgameTips.1: Iron golems will fight for you!
en_us.midgameTips.2: Feed a bone to a wolf to tame it. You can then make it sit or follow you.
en_us.midgameTips.3: Wearing a pumpkin on your head will keep Endermen from attacking you.
en_us.midgameTips.4: Harvest leather from cows, and use it to make armor and books.
en_us.midgameTips.5: You can fill an empty bucket with water, lava, milk, powdered snow... and even some mobs.
en_us.midgameTips.6: Feeding an animal will keep it from despawning. Build a pen to keep your animals safe.
en_us.midgameTips.7: Get to your destination faster with a minecart and some rails!
en_us.midgameTips.8: Building a portal will allow you to travel to another dimension called the Nether.
en_us.midgameTips.9: Bonemeal (crafted from a skeleton bone) can be used as a fertilizer and can make things grow instantly!
en_us.midgameTips.10: Obsidian is created when water hits a lava source block.
en_us.midgameTips.11: If the source block for water or lava is removed, it will stop the flow completely.
en_us.midgameTips.12: Blocks that can be used as a light source will melt snow and ice.
en_us.midgameTips.13: Take caution when building structures made of wool out in the open, as lightning from thunderstorms can set wool on fire.
en_us.midgameTips.14: A single bucket of lava can be used in a furnace to smelt 100 blocks.
en_us.midgameTips.15: The instrument played by a note block depends on the material beneath it.
en_us.midgameTips.16: Attacking a wolf will cause any wolves nearby to turn hostile and attack you.
en_us.midgameTips.17: Wolves and iron golems won't attack creepers.
en_us.midgameTips.18: Chickens lay an egg every 5 to 10 minutes.
en_us.midgameTips.19: Obsidian can be mined with a diamond pickaxe.
en_us.midgameTips.20: Creepers are the easiest obtainable source of gunpowder.
en_us.midgameTips.21: Tame wolves show their health with the position of their tail. Feed them meat to heal them.
en_us.midgameTips.22: Different colored dyes can be made from a variety of materials, cook cactus in a furnace to get green dye!
en_us.midgameTips.23: Pigs that are struck by lightning become zombified piglins.
en_us.midgameTips.25: Sometimes iron golems give flowers to the villager children!
en_us.midgameTips.27: Use seagrass to attract and breed sea turtles.
en_us.midgameTips.28: Protect baby turtles from hostile mobs!
en_us.midgameTips.29: Baby turtles will drop scutes when they grow - these can be crafted into turtle shells.
en_us.midgameTips.30: Brew some water breathing potions for underwater exploration!
en_us.midgameTips.31: Dolphins can lead you to shipwrecks and underwater ruins, feed them cod and follow their trail!
en_us.midgameTips.32: Use shears to carve a pumpkin.
en_us.midgameTips.33: There are 3587 types of tropical fish!
en_us.midgameTips.34: Sea pickles can be smelted into lime green dye.
en_us.midgameTips.35: Use hay bales to breed Llamas!
en_us.midgameTips.36: Compasses always point to the world spawn - craft one to find your way!
en_us.midgameTips.37: Trade with villagers to obtain food, tools, and even explorer maps!
en_us.midgameTips.38: Did you know you can hold a map in your off-hand?
en_us.midgameTips.39: Leads can be used on boats.
en_us.midgameTips.40: Sneak to walk safely on magma blocks.
en_us.midgameTips.41: You can gather cobwebs using shears.
en_us.midgameTips.42: Tridents are dropped by the Drowned, and can be held or thrown.
en_us.midgameTips.43: You can smelt 20 items in a furnace by using a block of dried kelp as fuel.
en_us.midgameTips.44: Taming a skeleton horse doesn't require a saddle.
en_us.midgameTips.45: Phantoms are dangerous mobs that appear during the night. Make sure to sleep regularly!
en_us.midgameTips.46: Zombies turn into drowned if they sink underwater.
en_us.midgameTips.50: When digging straight up, place a torch at your feet to break any sand or gravel that could potentially fall down on you.
en_us.midgameTips.51: Shear a Beehive or nest to get Honeycomb, use a Bottle to get honey.
en_us.midgameTips.52: Place a campfire under a beehive or nest to harvest honey.
en_us.midgameTips.53: Emerald ores are the rarest ores in Minecraft! They can only be found in mountains and meadows.
en_us.midgameTips.54: Need diamonds? They get more common as you go deeper.
en_us.midgameTips.55: Frogs eat small and blocky mobs.
en_us.midgameTips.56: The Allay loves to collect items! If you give it a certain item it will try to collect more of it.
en_us.midgameTips.57: Frogs pick a variant based on the temperature of the biome the tadpole grow up in.
en_us.midgameTips.58: You can collect tadpoles in buckets.
en_us.midgameTips.59: Ancient cities can be found under mountain ranges.
en_us.midgameTips.60: Allays love music and therefore interact with noteblocks!
en_us.midgameTips.61: Use a water bottle on a dirt block to get mud!
en_us.midgameTips.62: When wandering in the deep dark, silence is key.
en_us.midgameTips.63: Some animals will follow you if you have wheat in your hand.
en_us.midgameTips.64: Before you mine diamonds, redstone, or gold, make sure you're using an iron or diamond pickaxe or it won't work.
en_us.midgameTips.65: Placing two chests side by side will make one large chest.
en_us.midgameTips.66: Can't find any coal for your torches? Try putting some logs in a furnace.
en_us.midgameTips.68: Plant some saplings and they'll grow into trees.
en_us.midgameTips.69: Use a hoe to prepare areas of ground for planting.
en_us.lategameTips.1: Zombified piglins won't attack you - unless you make them angry.
en_us.lategameTips.2: Hit those fireballs back at the Ghast!
en_us.lategameTips.3: Cobblestone is resistant to Ghast fireballs, making it useful for guarding portals.
en_us.lategameTips.4: Our music is by C418, Lena Raine, Aaron Cherof, and Kumi Tanioka.
en_us.lategameTips.5: There will be an update to this game eventually!
en_us.lategameTips.6: Creepers were born from a coding bug.
en_us.lategameTips.7: The first version of Minecraft was created in just 6 days!
en_us.lategameTips.8: The Enderman language is actually English in reverse.
en_us.lategameTips.9: The original name for Minecraft was Cave Game.
en_us.lategameTips.10: A Spider Jockey is the rare appearance of a spider being ridden by a skeleton!
en_us.lategameTips.11: Traveling one block in the Nether is equal to traveling eight blocks in the Overworld.
en_us.lategameTips.12: Use phantom membranes to repair your elytra.
en_us.lategameTips.13: Elytra can be used to glide, find them in End city ships!
en_us.lategameTips.14: Test out some new features by turning on Experimental Gameplay in the settings menu!
en_us.lategameTips.15: Monsters that are killed by skeletons arrows have a chance of dropping music discs.
en_us.lategameTips.16: Texture packs change the way that blocks, items, and even the menus look in game. Try them out!
en_us.lategameTips.17: Using firework rockets boosts elytra speed in mid air. Just... make sure they don't explode, otherwise it'll hurt BADLY!
en_us.lategameTips.19: Riptide enchantment will propel you through the air in the rain.
en_us.lategameTips.20: The Beacon is a powerful item that can only be crafted with a Nether star from the Wither!
en_us.lategameTips.21: Nether stars can't be destroyed by explosions.
en_us.lategameTips.23: Respawning in the Nether requires a charged respawn anchor.
en_us.lategameTips.24: You can charge a respawn anchor with glowstone.
en_us.lategameTips.25: You can breed hoglins with crimson fungus, but be careful.
en_us.lategameTips.26: Gold is most common in the Nether and in the badlands biome.
en_us.lategameTips.27: Diorite, you either love it or hate it.
en_us.tips.creative.1: Bored of gravity? Jump twice to fly!
en_us.tips.creative.2: Summon mobs in an instant with spawn eggs.
en_us.tips.creative.3: Collect goat horns and fill the world with music.
en_us.tips.creative.4: Combine flint and steel with a TNT block for explosive results.
en_us.tips.creative.5: Try blinking around the map with an ender pearl. Don't get dizzy!
en_us.tips.creative.6: Use rails and a minecart to build the perfect transport system. Or rollercoaster!
en_us.tips.creative.7: Seeking a little more danger? Survival mode has plenty.
en_us.tips.creative.8: Crossbows need ammo. Add some arrows to your inventory before going hunting.
en_us.tips.creative.9: You can't die, but villagers can. Use that information... wisely.
en_us.tips.creative.10: Villagers are great at building villages. Think you can do better?
en_us.tips.creative.11: Wolves will attack skeletons to chew on their tasty bones.
en_us.tips.creative.12: Tame wild horses by sitting on them until they're calm, then saddle up and ride off. (Note: Horses do not work like that outside of Minecraft.)
en_us.tips.creative.13: Eat as much as you want, you'll never get full! And you'll never starve.
en_us.tips.creative.14: Move through solid objects using spectator mode.
en_us.tips.creative.15: Who needs tools? Punch your way to success and remove blocks instantly in creative mode.
en_us.tips.creative.16: Like what you see? Use the pick block button to start building with whatever you're looking at. Yes, even mobs!
en_us.tips.creative.17: Get there now with the /tp command.
en_us.tips.creative.18: Mobs won't notice you in creative mode, but they'll still notice each other...
en_us.tips.creative.19: A warden a day keeps the... well, everything away.
en_us.tips.creative.20: Why not build an underwater base? It's not like you can drown.
en_us.tips.creative.21: Whatever you can dream, you can build. There's no limit to your resources (in creative mode...).
en_us.tips.creative.22: Phantoms can't hurt you, but you can still shoo them off by using a bed. Just...not literally. You sleep in it.
en_us.tips.creative.23: Have you tried swimming in lava? It's like sinking into a warm bath. Just don't try it in survival mode...
